elements.description:
`<responsive-canvas>` is a wrapper for the `<canvas>` element that will automatically set
the `width` and `height` attribute of the canvas if it is resized.

properties.name: renderCallback
properties.description:
The callback that is used to render the content of the canvas.
Should be a method handling the `canvas` as an argument: `function render(canvas)`.

methods.name: _refreshCanvas
methods.description: Refreshes the canvas by re-setting its size and re-rendering it.

methods.name: _refreshCanvasSize
methods.description: Re-sets the size of the canvas.

methods.name: renderCanvas
methods.description: Renders the canvas using the provided `renderCallback`.

elements.name: Vaadin.ColorPicker.ResponsiveCanvasElement

attributes.name: render-callback
attributes.description:
The callback that is used to render the content of the canvas.
Should be a method handling the `canvas` as an argument: `function render(canvas)`.

elements.description:
`ColorSliderElement` is an extendable base class for all sliders regarding color.

It allows to specify a render function to render the sliders background.

properties.name: focusElement
properties.description: The element to focus.

properties.name: enableX
properties.description: Enable the possibility to move the handle in the X-direction.

properties.name: enableY
properties.description: Enable the possibility to move the handle in the Y-direction.

properties.name: valueX
properties.description: The current X-value.

properties.name: valueY
properties.description: The current Y-value.

properties.name: minX
properties.description: The lower bound of the X-value.

properties.name: minY
properties.description: The lower bound of the Y-value.

properties.name: maxX
properties.description: The upper bound of the X-value.

properties.name: maxY
properties.description: The upper bound of the Y-value.

properties.name: stepX
properties.description:
The steps that are added and removed to the current X-value if the slider handle is
moved.

properties.name: stepY
properties.description:
The steps that are added and removed to the current Y-value if the slider handle is
moved.

properties.name: renderCallback
properties.description: The callback that is used to render the sliders background.

methods.name: renderCanvas
methods.description: Render the sliders background on the canvas.

methods.name: onResize
methods.description: Repositions the handler if resized.

methods.name: _setupHandle
methods.description: Setup the handle.

methods.name: _invertedX
methods.description: Check if the upper bound is smaller than the lower bound on the X-axis.

methods.name: _invertedY
methods.description: Check if the upper bound is smaller than the lower bound on the Y-axis.

methods.name: _increaseX
methods.description: Increase the x-value depending on the fact whether the X-axis is inverted.

methods.name: _decreaseX
methods.description: Decrease the x-value depending on the fact whether the X-axis is inverted.

methods.name: _increaseY
methods.description: Increase the x-value depending on the fact whether the Y-axis is inverted.

methods.name: _decreaseY
methods.description: Decrease the x-value depending on the fact whether the Y-axis is inverted.

methods.name: _valueXChanged
methods.description: Reposition the handle if the X-value changed.

methods.name: _valueYChanged
methods.description: Reposition the handle if the Y-value changed.

elements.name: Vaadin.ColorPicker.ColorSliderElement

attributes.name: enable-y

attributes.name: value-y

attributes.name: min-y
attributes.description: The lower bound of the Y-value.

attributes.name: max-y

elements.description:
`<sl-slider>` is an element that allows to select a **saturation** and **lightness** value
from the hsv color space using a slider.

properties.name: hue
properties.description: The **h**sv-hue of the color to show as background in the range `[0 - 360]`.

methods.name: _renderSl
methods.description: The render callback for the background.

elements.name: Vaadin.ColorPicker.SlSliderElement

attributes.name: hue
attributes.description: The **h**sv-hue of the color to show as background in the range `[0 - 360]`.

elements.description: `<hue-slider>` is an element that allows to select a **hue** value using a slider.

methods.name: _renderHue
methods.description: The render callback for the background.

elements.name: Vaadin.ColorPicker.HueSliderElement

elements.description: `<alpha-slider>` is an element that allows to select an **alpha** value using a slider.

properties.description: The **h**sv-hue of the color to show as background in the range `[0 - 360]`.

properties.name: value
properties.description: The hs**v**-value of the color to show as background in the range `[0 - 1]`.

methods.name: _renderAlpha
methods.description: The render callback for the background depending on the current hue.

attributes.description: The **h**sv-hue of the color to show as background in the range `[0 - 360]`.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The hs**v**-value of the color to show as background in the range `[0 - 1]`.

elements.description:
`<selected-color>` shows a selected color. If a previous color is specified, this one will
be also visible.

properties.name: previousValue
properties.description: The previous value.

methods.name: _hasPreviousColor
methods.description: Check if a value is set for the previous value.

methods.name: _renderSelectedColor
methods.description: Callback to render the selected color.

methods.name: _renderPreviousColor
methods.description: Callback to render the previous color.

staticMethods.name: _renderColor
staticMethods.description: Render a color to a canvas.

params.name: canvas
params.description: The canvas to show the color in.

params.name: color
params.description:
The color to show in the format of a valid
[chroma.js](https://github.com/gka/chroma.js/|chroma.js) chroma object

elements.name: Vaadin.ColorPicker.SelectedColorElement

attributes.name: previous-value
attributes.description: The previous value.

properties.name: previousValue
properties.description: The previous value.

properties.name: disableAlpha
properties.description: Disable the input of **alpha** values.

properties.name: _hue
properties.description: The current hue in the range `[0 - 360]`.

properties.name: _saturation
properties.description: The current saturation in the range `[0 - 1]`.

properties.name: _value
properties.description: The current value in the range `[0 - 1]`.

properties.name: _alpha
properties.description: The current alpha in the range `[0 - 1]`.

methods.name: _sliderColorChanged
methods.description: Update the color value if the slider values changed.

methods.name: _valueChanged
methods.description: Update the slider values if the color value changed.

methods.name: _colorChanged
methods.description: Prevent endless recursion.

elements.name: Vaadin.ColorPicker.ColorPickerSliderElement

attributes.name: previous-value
attributes.description: The previous value.

attributes.name: disable-alpha
attributes.description: Disable the input of **alpha** values.

elements.description:
`` allows to switch between elements and display one of them at a time. Additionally all elements can be displayed at once. ```
Content 1
Content 2
Content 3
``` If an element has the attribute `disable-for-switch` it will be hidden and ignored in the carousel. This is useful if using the e.g. with `` as it is rendered inside the carousel. ``` ```

properties.name: pinned
properties.description: Switch between showing all elements at once or just a single element.

methods.name: _refreshElementVisibility
methods.description: Refreshes the visibility of the elements.

methods.name: _displayIndex
methods.description:
Try to display the element at the given index.
If the element at the index is not relevant, increase the index until an element to be
displayed is found.

params.name: index
params.description: The index of the element to display

methods.name: _isElementRelevant
methods.description: Check if an element is enabled for the carousel.

return.desc: `true` if the element is relevant, `false` else

methods.name: _displayNextElement
methods.description: Shows the next element in the carousel.

elements.name: Vaadin.ColorPicker.ElementCarouselElement

attributes.name: pinned
attributes.description: Switch between showing all elements at once or just a single element.

elements.description:
`ColorInputElement` is an extendable base class for all inputs regarding color.

It handles the setting and converting the value from the input and from
outside without causing stack overflows due to endless recursions.

properties.name: _colorSupplier
properties.description:
The supplier function that is called if one of the `_observedInputProperties` is
changed and the `value` property should be updated.

Should return a valid [chroma.js](https://github.com/gka/chroma.js/|chroma.js) chroma
object, e.g.:

```() => chroma.rgb(255, 255, 255)```

properties.name: _toInputConverter
properties.description:
The converter function that is called if the `value` property changed and the inputs
should be updated.

Should consume the [chroma.js](https://github.com/gka/chroma.js/|chroma.js) `value`
as an argument, e.g.:

```value => console.info(value)```

properties.name: _observedInputProperties
properties.description:
The properties that should trigger a call to `_colorSupplier` as the color has
changed from the input side.

properties.name: disableAlpha
properties.description: Show and handle alpha values in the input.

methods.name: _updateInput
methods.description: Update the input with the new `value`.

methods.name: _updateColor
methods.description: Update the `value` from the input.

elements.name: Vaadin.ColorPicker.ColorInputElement

attributes.name: disable-alpha
attributes.description: Show and handle alpha values in the input.

elements.description: `<hex-input>` is an element that allows to input **hex** color codes.

properties.name: _colorSupplier
properties.description:
The supplier function that is called if one of the `_observedInputProperties` is
changed and the `value` property should be updated.

Should return a valid [chroma.js](https://github.com/gka/chroma.js/|chroma.js) chroma
object, e.g.:

```() => chroma.rgb(255, 255, 255)```

properties.name: _toInputConverter
properties.description:
The converter function that is called if the `value` property changed and the inputs
should be updated.

Should consume the [chroma.js](https://github.com/gka/chroma.js/|chroma.js) `value`
as an argument, e.g.:

```value => console.info(value)```

properties.name: _observedInputProperties
properties.description:
The properties that should trigger a call to `_colorSupplier` as the color has
changed from the input side.

properties.name: disableAlpha
properties.description: Show and handle alpha values in the input.

properties.name: hex
properties.description:
The color value as hex without the leading `#`.
Includes alpha value if enabled (e.g. `#FF00FF00`).

methods.name: _updateInput
methods.description: Update the input with the new `value`.

methods.name: _updateColor
methods.description: Update the `value` from the input.

methods.name: _getPattern
methods.description: Returns the input validation pattern.

return.desc: The pattern depending on the setting of `disableAlpha`.

elements.name: Vaadin.ColorPicker.HexInputElement

attributes.name: disable-alpha
attributes.description: Show and handle alpha values in the input.

attributes.name: hex
attributes.description:
The color value as hex without the leading `#`.
Includes alpha value if enabled (e.g. `#FF00FF00`).

`<color-picker-input>` allows to select a color from different inputs:

* RGBA
* HSLA

elements.description:
`<color-checkbox>` extends the `<vaadin-checkbox>` to be suitable for selecting colors.
The color of the checkmark itself will be adjusted automatically to be readable on the
background color of the checkbox.

properties.name: autofocus
properties.description: Specify that this control should have input focus when the page loads.

properties.name: _previousTabIndex
properties.description: Stores the previous value of tabindex attribute of the disabled element

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: If true, the user cannot interact with this element.

properties.name: checked
properties.description: True if the checkbox is checked.

properties.name: indeterminate
properties.description:
Indeterminate state of the checkbox when it's neither checked nor unchecked, but undetermined.
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input/checkbox#Indeterminate_state_checkboxes

properties.name: value
properties.description: The value given to the data submitted with the checkbox's name to the server when the control is inside a form.

properties.name: color
properties.description:
The color for the checkbox in the form of a
[chroma.js](https://github.com/gka/chroma.js/|chroma.js) chroma object.

methods.name: focus
methods.description: Moving the focus from the host element causes firing of the blur event what leads to problems in IE.

methods.name: blur
methods.description:
Native bluring in the host element does nothing because it does not have the focus.
In chrome it works, but not in FF.

methods.name: _addEventListenerToNode
methods.description: Add the event listener to the node if it is a gestures event.

params.name: node
params.description: Node to add event listener to

methods.name: _removeEventListenerFromNode
methods.description: Remove the event listener to the node if it is a gestures event.

params.name: node
params.description: Node to remove event listener from

methods.name: __interactionsAllowed
methods.description:
True if users' interactions (mouse or keyboard)
should toggle the checkbox

methods.name: _toggleChecked
methods.description: Disable un-checking the checkbox once it has been checked.

methods.name: _onColorChanged
methods.description: Update the checkbox styles.

elements.name: Vaadin.ColorPicker.ColorCheckboxElement

attributes.name: autofocus
attributes.description: Specify that this control should have input focus when the page loads.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: If true, the user cannot interact with this element.

attributes.name: checked
attributes.description: True if the checkbox is checked.

attributes.name: indeterminate
attributes.description:
Indeterminate state of the checkbox when it's neither checked nor unchecked, but undetermined.
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input/checkbox#Indeterminate_state_checkboxes

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The value given to the data submitted with the checkbox's name to the server when the control is inside a form.

attributes.name: color
attributes.description:
The color for the checkbox in the form of a
[chroma.js](https://github.com/gka/chroma.js/|chroma.js) chroma object.

events.name: change
events.description: Fired when the user commits a value change.

elements.description: `<color-palette>` shows a set of colors that can be selected.

properties.name: palette
properties.description:
The palette of colors to show. Each color in the array should be a
[chroma.js](https://github.com/gka/chroma.js/|chroma.js) chroma object.

methods.name: _setColorFromPalette
methods.description: Set the current value.

methods.name: _isSelected
methods.description: Check if a the provided color is the current value.

elements.name: Vaadin.ColorPicker.ColorPaletteElement

attributes.name: palette
attributes.description:
The palette of colors to show. Each color in the array should be a
[chroma.js](https://github.com/gka/chroma.js/|chroma.js) chroma object.

elements.description: `<color-picker-palette>` shows a set color palettes from which a color can be selected.

properties.name: palettes
properties.description:
The palettes to show whereas each palette should be an array of
[chroma.js](https://github.com/gka/chroma.js/|chroma.js) chroma objects.

properties.name: pinned
properties.description: Pin all palettes visible or show them in a carousel.

elements.name: Vaadin.ColorPicker.ColorPickerPaletteElement

attributes.name: palettes
attributes.description:
The palettes to show whereas each palette should be an array of
[chroma.js](https://github.com/gka/chroma.js/|chroma.js) chroma objects.

attributes.name: pinned
attributes.description: Pin all palettes visible or show them in a carousel.

elements.description:
`<color-picker>` allows to select a color using sliders, inputs or palettes.

```
<color-picker></color-picker>
```
elements.name: Vaadin.ColorPicker.ColorPicker
